question: 携帯電話
sourceMnemonic: You know that <ja>携帯</ja> means "portable" or "cell phone" or "mobile phone." And then <ja>電話</ja> means "telephone." This is basically just the longer version of simply saying <ja>携帯</ja>, making this a <vocabulary>portable phone</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>cell phone</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>mobile phone</vocabulary>. It's sort of like the difference between saying "my cell" and "my cell phone," you dig?
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. Will help to know the readings of <ja>携帯</ja> and <ja>電話</ja> for this one.
